content.description: Start sitting under the apex of the roof and climb up to the top without dropping off
content.protection: Lots of pads and a high sand level would be ideal.
content.location: Center of the North overhang, the steepest, scariest part!

content.protection: Depends on sand level which can be significant, a towel and pad are always nice to keep the sand off of your shoes.
content.location: Right next to the big roof of the cove. obvious diagonal traverse on cool holds.

content.description: Highball up the left side of the overhanging cove. Start low/standing/sitting depending on the sand level on the diagonal rail and climb over the big roof of the cove. V7 if you climb the right side of the roof.
content.location: The middle of the overhang and slightly to the left.

content.description: Start as for Intruding Dyke V7 variation, but angle up and right to the apex of the roof. Don't fall on the slab! Like all the other problems this is best and safest at a high sand level.
content.protection: Lots of pads. Use your head when attempting!

content.description: Sit start on the far left side of the boulder and traverse right staying low. Finish either straight up after traverseing to the obvious jug or turn the corner with a big but easy move to a good hold. Stellar rock quality, Tide dependant. You may have to brush the sand off the holds.
content.location: Past the last face facing the ocean with the V1's on it. The obvious odd coloured boulder.
